message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SD, cs.HC. 

This paper deals with neural conversational models, which are primarily used in natural language processing (NLP) and computational linguistics. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also proposes novel techniques to incorporate affective/emotional aspects into these models, which involves machine learning and artificial intelligence, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) another likely category. The techniques proposed in the paper involve the use of long short term memory (LSTM) networks, which are a type of deep learning model, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another possible category. The paper also discusses the importance of affective content in human-to-human dialogue, which relates to the field of social computing, making cs.SD (Sound) another possible category. Finally, the paper proposes techniques to improve the naturalness of responses generated by neural conversational models, which is relevant to human-computer interaction, making cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) another possible category.
